mandelbrot

Class ComplexValue

  • java.lang.Object
    • mandelbrot.ComplexValue

  • public class ComplexValue
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    John Bannister Instances of this class represent a complex number. Is instantiated with its real and imaginary parts. A ComplexValue determines its inclusion in the Mandelbrot set. If a number is in the set, it has with it an associated order, which is the number of iterations of the operation must be performed to reach the threshold. A ComplexValue has a color, which it determines from its order.

      the real portion of this number
      static double THRESHOLD
      if ITERATIONS times through the operation we are below this THRESHOLD in both the real and imaginary parts, then this complex value is in the Mandelbrot set

        Returns:

      • computeOrder

        private void computeOrder()
        the algorithm that determines inclusion in the Mandelbrot set:

        for a complex number c = real + imaginary, set a complex number z to initially be 0 + 0i. Successively redefine z to be

        z = z^2 + c

        If |zReal| is bounded above, c is in the Mandelbrot set. Otherwise, the number of times that z has been redefined is the order of c, by which an associated color can be determined.

        This method also sets order

      • setColor

        private int setColor(int count)
        Produce a color for each complex value

        Returns:
